mechanics.trigger: Spell is cast
mechanics.condition: Caster casts Magic Jar
mechanics.outcome: Caster's soul leaves its body and enters the spell's container. Caster's original body falls into a catatonic state.

mechanics.trigger: Caster's soul is in the container
mechanics.condition: Caster's soul is in the container
mechanics.outcome: Caster is aware of its surroundings as if in the container's space.

mechanics.trigger: Caster's soul is in the container
mechanics.condition: Caster's soul is in the container
mechanics.outcome: Caster cannot move or use reactions.

mechanics.trigger: Caster's soul is in the container
mechanics.condition: Caster's soul is in the container
mechanics.outcome: Caster can use its action to project its soul up to 100 feet out of the container.

mechanics.trigger: Caster projects soul
mechanics.condition: Caster chooses to return to their original body
mechanics.outcome: Caster's soul returns to its original body, and the Magic Jar spell ends.

mechanics.trigger: Caster attempts possession
mechanics.condition: Target is a Humanoid AND target is within 100 feet AND Caster can see target AND target is NOT warded by Protection from Evil and Good OR Magic Circle
mechanics.outcome: Caster can attempt to possess the target's body.

mechanics.trigger: Caster attempts possession of a valid target
mechanics.condition: Caster attempts possession
mechanics.outcome: Target must make a Charisma saving throw.

mechanics.trigger: Target fails Charisma saving throw
mechanics.condition: Target failed the Charisma saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Caster's soul moves into the target's body. The target's original soul becomes trapped in the container.

mechanics.trigger: Target succeeds on Charisma saving throw
mechanics.condition: Target succeeded on the Charisma saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Target resists possession. Caster cannot attempt to possess this specific target again for 24 hours.

mechanics.trigger: Caster possesses a creature's body
mechanics.condition: Caster is possessing a creature's body
mechanics.outcome: Caster controls the possessed body.

mechanics.trigger: Caster possesses a creature's body
mechanics.condition: Caster is possessing a creature's body
mechanics.outcome: Caster's game statistics are replaced by the possessed creature's statistics, EXCEPT Caster retains its own alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.

mechanics.trigger: Caster possesses a creature's body
mechanics.condition: Caster is possessing a creature's body
mechanics.outcome: Caster retains the benefit of its own class features. If the possessed creature has class levels, Caster cannot use any of the possessed creature's class features.

mechanics.trigger: Creature's soul is trapped in the container
mechanics.condition: A creature's soul is trapped in the container
mechanics.outcome: The trapped soul can perceive from the container using its own senses but cannot move or take actions.

mechanics.trigger: Caster is possessing a body
mechanics.condition: Caster uses an action AND the container is within 100 feet
mechanics.outcome: Caster's soul returns from the host body to the container. The host creature's soul returns to its own body.

mechanics.trigger: Host body dies while Caster is possessing it
mechanics.condition: Host body dies while Caster is possessing it
mechanics.outcome: The host creature dies.

mechanics.trigger: Host body dies while Caster is possessing it
mechanics.condition: Host body dies while Caster is possessing it
mechanics.outcome: Caster must make a Charisma saving throw against its own spellcasting DC.

mechanics.trigger: Caster made Charisma saving throw (Host body died)
mechanics.condition: Caster succeeded on the Charisma saving throw AND the container is within 100 feet
mechanics.outcome: Caster's soul returns to the container.

mechanics.trigger: Caster made Charisma saving throw (Host body died)
mechanics.condition: Caster failed the Charisma saving throw OR the container is NOT within 100 feet
mechanics.outcome: Caster dies.

mechanics.trigger: Container is destroyed OR Magic Jar spell ends
mechanics.condition: Container is destroyed OR Magic Jar spell ends
mechanics.outcome: Caster's soul immediately returns to its original body.

mechanics.trigger: Container is destroyed OR Magic Jar spell ends
mechanics.condition: Caster's original body is more than 100 feet away from Caster's current soul location OR Caster's original body is dead
mechanics.outcome: Caster dies.

mechanics.trigger: Container is destroyed OR Magic Jar spell ends
mechanics.condition: Another creature's soul is in the container AND its original body is alive AND its original body is within 100 feet of the container
mechanics.outcome: The other creature's soul returns to its original body.

mechanics.trigger: Container is destroyed OR Magic Jar spell ends
mechanics.condition: Another creature's soul is in the container AND its original body is NOT alive OR its original body is NOT within 100 feet of the container
mechanics.outcome: The other creature dies.

mechanics.trigger: Magic Jar spell ends
mechanics.condition: Magic Jar spell ends
mechanics.outcome: The container used for the spell's material component is destroyed.

description_text: Your body falls into a catatonic state as your soul leaves it and enters the container you used for the spell's material component. While your soul inhabits the container, you are aware of your surroundings as if you were in the container's space. You can't move or use reactions. The only action you can take is to project your soul up to 100 feet out of the container, either returning to your living body (and ending the spell) or attempting to possess a humanoids body. You can attempt to possess any humanoid within 100 feet of you that you can see (creatures warded by a protection from evil and good or magic circle spell can't be possessed). The target must make a charisma saving throw. On a failure, your soul moves into the target's body, and the target's soul becomes trapped in the container. On a success, the target resists your efforts to possess it, and you can't attempt to possess it again for 24 hours. Once you possess a creature's body, you control it. Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the creature, though you retain your alignment and your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You retain the benefit of your own class features. If the target has any class levels, you can't use any of its class features. Meanwhile, the possessed creature's soul can perceive from the container using its own senses, but it can't move or take actions at all. While possessing a body, you can use your action to return from the host body to the container if it is within 100 feet of you, returning the host creature's soul to its body. If the host body dies while you're in it, the creature dies, and you must make a charisma saving throw against your own spellcasting DC. On a success, you return to the container if it is within 100 feet of you. Otherwise, you die. If the container is destroyed or the spell ends, your soul immediately returns to your body. If your body is more than 100 feet away from you or if your body is dead when you attempt to return to it, you die. If another creature's soul is in the container when it is destroyed, the creature's soul returns to its body if the body is alive and within 100 feet. Otherwise, that creature dies. When the spell ends, the container is destroyed.
